content: side part wig crochet note on turning you can use a turning chain and not count it as a stitch or any other method you prefer the pattern will not specify how to turn chain 143 single_crochet in each chain good luck you can use an single_crochet foundation chain instead first decrease single_crochet 1 decrease 1 now 96 stitches decreased by 1/3 setup rib 1 row of double_crochet setup double_crochet tc in back post bptc ws double_crochet tc in front post fptc rs ribbing should be visible now 1x1 decrease to 1x3 rib single_crochet decrease 1 again now 65 stitches decreased by 1/3 ws new ribbing pattern is double_crochet 3 post tc double_crochet to account for the decreases each row starts and ends with double_crochet make sure you are going into the front post 2 row down skip the single_crochet row rs main body stay in pattern until you reach the top of ear by holding up to your face with bottom edge where you want it to fall at chin under chin at shoulder etc for me this was 9 row but you have flexibility to make the body shorter or longer make sure your last row is a ws row place markers place markers @ 19 26 19 to divide into side back side start side bang on next rs at end of row on last 2 st 2dc 2dc 3 increase bangs will be on left side of wig on ws double_crochet bptc in 3 increased dcs double_crochet in main chain to complete 3 bptc double_crochet cluster continue in pattern to end of row on end of next rs increase 3 again ws in pattern after first increase after 2nd increase work 4 row in pattern non-bang side should be at desired part height work 1 row and when you get to the back section work as decrease all the way across to marker decrease by ½ work last section bang section in pattern work 2 row only on bang side the last row should be a ws decrease back down on end of next rs after last double_crochet before increased stitches 3fptc decrease work the next double_crochet 3 fptc double_crochet in pattern turn on ws double_crochet 3 bptc triple decrease double_crochet should be double_crochet top of 3 fptc decrease from rs double_crochet see glossary for steps repeat the last 2 row to decrease the last added 1dc 3 fptc group and return to the original stitch count 19 you will be at the end of the bang side at the back of the wig slip_stitch back to the front of the wig finishing put right sides facing each other on inside and use slip_stitch or single_crochet to graft both sides together graft 19 stitches when you get to the end you will have a gap between the now-grafted part and the back you will have to graft that back
